__e: When it's done, you can feel as sorry as you wish.
It kills me however to have to tell you I'm sorry, I just--
That's the only regret I'll have after my death.
But having seen and having heard what I have during this trial, the pain, the loss, the regret, above all the waste.
It means when life gets you all swirly and thought-ridden, shut it out, and let the two spherical sperm factories underneath your dick take over.
The person you want to be does exist, somewhere on the other side of hard work and faith and belief and beyond heartache and fear of what lies ahead.
And so it's with a heavy heart I must legally change my name.
I mean, you know, I don't see how that should factor in to whether we're best friends or not.
And I cannot say which is the greater grief to my heart.
Even if you're right, this must weigh 500 kilos.
You know, I remember a lifetime ago... I was about three and a half feet tall... weighing all of sixty pounds, but every inch your son.
Biggest sailfish I ever latched onto. Must have weighed 140, if he weighed a pound. - Up ten.
Everything is fine. Say, I bet he weighs more than any kid his age, huh?
I mean, your clothes weigh more than that.
